title: Ticket #4127: Disconnection during job cleanup can crash shadow
description:
If the shadow becomes disconnected from the starter during job cleanup, it can crash as it starts running another job.

I haven't traced the exact course of events, but this is an outline of what I'm seeing:

  • Transfer of output files completes
  • shadow becomes disconnected
  • job termination code executes
  • shadow is recycled for a new job
  • shadow crashes

At the point of the crash, daemonCore is attempting to call a timer named "RemoteResource::attemptReconnect()". The destination of the call is bogus and the process segfaults.

It appears that the shadow is in the process of cleaning up the terminated job when the disconnect happens. A timer is registered to attempt a reconnect. Before the timer can fire, the job termination code path completes and the shadow is recycled, including deleting the RemoteResource object. The destructor for RemoteResource does not cancel the timer. Then the reconnect timer fires, invoking a method on a RemoteResource object whose memory has been reused.

The destructor for RemoteResource should cancel the reconnect timer (the identifier is stored in data member next_reconnect_tid).
remarks:
2013-Dec-18 10:59:25 by jfrey:
BaseShadow::m_cleanup_retry_tid is another timer that should be canceled when the object is destroyed.

2014-Jan-24 16:23:50 by tlmiller:
CODE REVIEW

Looks good. Checked for other TIDs missing deregistration, didn't see any.

(Resolving, since it looks like the docs are done.)
